required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cost of Cancer Diagnosis Using Next-generation Sequencing Targeted Gene Panels in Routine Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Cost of Cancer Diagnosis Using Next-generation Sequencing Targeted Gene Panels in Routine Practice: a Nationwide French Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to measure the total cost of performing next-generation sequencing (NGS) in clinical practice in France, in both germline and somatic cancer genetics.
The study was performed on 15 French representative cancer molecular genetics laboratories performing NGS panels' tests. The production cost was estimated using a micro-costing method with resources consumed collected in situ in each laboratory from a healthcare provider perspective. A top-down methodology for specific post-sequencing steps was used.
Additional non-specific costs were also included and costs were detailed per step of the process.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
primary_outcome.description: The study is performed on 15 French representative cancer molecular genetics laboratories performing NGS panels' tests. The production cost is estimated using a micro-costing method with resources consumed collected in situ in each laboratory from a healthcare provider perspective. A top-down methodology for specific post-sequencing steps is used.

intervention.intervention_name: Measure of the total cost of performing next-generation sequencing (NGS)
intervention.description: Resources consumed were collected for each laboratory using a standardized questionnaire. The production costs were calculated for the overall process and resources consumed for each step were identified.

study_pop.textblock: French laboratories (7 somatic genetics and 8 germline oncogenetic) currently performing NGS.The laboratories were chosen because they performed cancer diagnostics nationwide and presented the full spectrum of clinical indications and technical solutions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- French genetics laboratories performing somatic and germline clinical NGS tests.
Exclusion Criteria:
-
